MIT 2.094 21. Plates and shells Aside: Why not just neglect transverse shears, as in Kirchho plate theory? w w If we do, xz = x x =0 x = x Therefore we have 2 w in strains, so we need continuity also for x2 , w x
w = 21 r(1 + r)w1 21 r(1 r)w2 + 1 r 2 w3 w2 and w3 never aect w1 ( w|r=1 = w1). But, w 1 1 r = 2(1+2r)w1 2(1 2r)w2 2rw3 w w2 and w3 aect r . This results in diculties to develop a good 1 elemen t based on Kirchho theory. With Reissner-Mindlin theory, we independently interpolate rotations such that this problem does not arise.
